planet.name: CFHTWIR-Oph 98 A b
planet.description: This planet was discovered by Fontanive et al. 2020. It is a planetary-mass companion to CFHTWIR-Oph 98, a low-mass brown dwarf member of the young Ophiuchus star-forming region. The low component masses and very large separation make this binary the lowest binding energy system imaged to date, indicating that the outcome of low-mass star formation can result in such extreme, weakly-bound systems. The discovery was made with the 2.4 m Hubble Space Telescope.
planet.imagedescription: Images of the Oph 98 binary system from the first epoch of CFHT data (left), HST observations (middle) and UKIRT data (right). North is up and East is left. Image credit: Fontanive et al. 2020.
